alert.note: Alert for Blount Smoky Mountains; NW Blount (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 6:46PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Blount County through 830 PM EDT... At 746 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Maryville, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Maryville, Alcoa, Eagleton Village, Smoky Mountains-Twentymile Creek, Smoky Mountains-Fontana Area, Townsend, Cades Cove, Happy Valley, Deals Gap and Great Smoky Mountains National Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
